steps.title: Make a wick.
steps.content: Make a wick. Take a washer and tie a piece of cotton cord to it. Place it in the jar and tie the other end to a pencil to keep some of the string upright. Your wick should be long enough that it is almost taught, but not quite. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cook bacon
steps.content: Cook bacon on the stove or the oven. Place the bacon on a hot frying pan or a tinfoil-lined baking pan. Lay several strips on the pan so the grease will pool and stop the bacon from burning. The hotter the bacon is, the thinner the grease will be and the easier it is to remove, but you should still be careful.

steps.title: Remove (and eat) the bacon and pour the grease into a smaller pan.
steps.content: Remove (and eat) the bacon and pour the grease into a smaller pan. Do this once the bacon in the pan has given the bulk of its grease. Simmer the grease on low to medium heat until it stops steaming. This will remove the water from the fat and allow for a better consistency for the candle. This can take several hours, so be patient. However, it may take less, or you can even use it without this step.

steps.title: Filter the grease.
steps.content: Filter the grease. While this step is optional, doing so will result in a candle that looks and smells cleaner, and leads to a better burn. Once the grease has finished steaming, filter it through a sieve or paper towel.

steps.title: Add beeswax.
steps.content: Add beeswax . To melt the wax , you can either add solid wax to the grease and melt it together while mixing or you could pre-melt the wax in a pan, or add the wax in a jar placed in a pot of water around 100° C or 210°F. Add 1 part wax to 2 parts grease.

steps.title: Add the wax to the grease if you have not already done so.
steps.content: Add the wax to the grease if you have not already done so. Mix until it is thoroughly combined. Consider mixing it in a heated stove pan.

steps.title: Pour the mixture in the jar.
steps.content: Pour the mixture in the jar. Heat your jar in the oven to prevent bubbles in the wax. Pour slowly and smoothly.

steps.title: Allow your mixture to cool slowly.
steps.content: Allow your mixture to cool slowly. Pour a small amount of grease into the jar, allow that to cool in the freezer, then pour some more until it is completely full

steps.title: Cut off the excess wick.
steps.content: Cut off the excess wick. Leave about 0.5 inches (about 1 cm) left over so it is easier to light.

steps.title: Store the candle in the freezer.
steps.content: Store the candle in the freezer. The Man-dle has a shelf life of several months without refrigeration, but storing it in the freezer will increase burn time.

steps.title: Light your candle
steps.content: Light your candle using a lighter or matches. Be careful not to burn yourself, and exercise common fire safety. Extinguish when leaving the house or area.
